name: James Gwin
text:
SEE SARAH FOR PIERCINGS!!
Sarah has been piercing me for 10 years. The only time I have ever used anyone else is when she took a short break to finish college.
The very first piercings Sarah did for me were my nipples. I was very nervous because I had always been told how painful male nipple piercings, but Sarah made me feel calm and relaxed by assuring me that it was worse in my head, the piercings were a little painful but nothing like I thought it would be. She did such an amazing job, so I've recommended her to everyone. She is always very professional, nice, gentle, and most important quick with a needle.
Since then, Sarah has also pierced my industrial, several other cartilage piercings, 6 Frenums, and my lobes using 6 gauge tunnels. The most recent piercings she did were both of my daiths for migraine relief; the first time in 7 years I have been migraine free for 3 months!!!
Every piercing she has ever done on me has healed perfectly and I have made sure to follow her aftercare instructions to the letter.
However while she was on break I went to 2 different shops nearby for piercings, one with a female piercer and one with a mail piercer/tattoo artist. I had a standard cartilage piercing done by the female piercer. She (along with staff at that shop) was very rude, charged almost double the price, offered no aftercare, insisted on using a ring instead of the bar like I was accustomed to, and told me they were using titanium jewelry.
I used the same aftercare that I've always used but the constant movement of the ring caused my ear to become so infected that I lost 2 completely healed piercings in that ear also. Later I found out that the jewelry they used was not titanium at all (not even titanium coated), it wasn't even nickel and lead tested surgical steel! When I went to the male piercer/tattoo artist's shop the place so sketchy and he was such a jerk that I left immediately.
I WILL NEVER LET ANYONE BUT SARAH PIERCE ME AGAIN. Thank you so much for all of your amazing work.

name: David Wilson
text:
I have to correct the last gentleman's review.  I work with the son of Professor Bob Dunn, who was also trained by Sailor Moses and I can assure you that the Matt Green at this shop is not the one that you are speaking of.  You were done wrong but you have the wrong Matt Green.  I have worked along side the Matt of this shop and he is a very well rounded and fully competent tattooer.  Extremely sterile environment and procedures along with a very pleasant shop experience.

Seriously dude, do your homework before you try to ruin the career and internet presence of a really good dude who is only guilty of having the same name as someone you are angry at.

name: Leslie Helton
text:
I've known the tattoo artists for many years and have watched Matt's skill progress extensively, as I still have some of his earliest work that we have not reworked yet, into the beautiful artwork he now produces!  Stephen's work is very organic and quite awesome to look at.  I met Vance earlier this year when we brought my daughter in to have her cheap wal-mart kit earrings replaced with body jewelry so they could heal, and he was VERY professional.  Recently I had Vance do some work for me as well, and I couldn't stress enough how professional this guy really is.  Very matter-of-fact when it comes to discussing what happens during healing time and what jewelry is best for that location.  I think their shop hours are AWESOME, by treating it more like a business by offering decent hours rather than a quick-stop tattoo mill open til midnight.

Awesome staff, awesome facility, awesome in general.  Best tattoo business in the Shoals, EVER.

text: Here on vacation, wanted to get a piercing for my birthday. We called to ask about pricing, and asked if we needed an appointment and they said they took walk ins at any time. We drove 30 MINUTES to this place because of good reviews, and we get there and stood in the lobby for about 10 minutes before anyone helped us, despite apparent workers walking back in and out the door, clearly seeing us. When finally helped, he told us that his piercer was out “picking up his kids” even though Tuesday’s are discount piercing days. The guy told us to come back the next day when the piercer was back in. We called back the next day to make sure he was there, and the piercer was  conveniently “getting foot surgery” and wouldn’t be in at all. He was terribly rude on the phone both days and in person. Very unprofessional and lost a lot of money considering a lot of girls were going to get pierced.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel that way we always take care of our clients as you can see from our reviews it makes me sad some one can give you bad review for not even given them service i am the piercer and did need stiches for a foot cut i received. Whish we could have helped you hopefully you will see this and reconsider your review.

My husband and I came in for my first tattoo. JC was very patient with me, listened to my ideas. I was very nervous but he went out of his way to make me feel comfortable. Walked me through step by step. Love my tattoo.
My husband got a tattoo while I was getting mine. Bruce listened to his ideas and added a few of his own. He did an awesome job on his tattoo. It was a great experience. Will definitely recommend both of these gentlemen. Awesome job guys and thanks!

text:
Horrible customer service.
Went to go see last week what the prices were, because I'm trying to save up money to get a couple piercings done at once and know where the best place would be since I'm in town visiting family for a bit, and the worker got mad because i didn't want to get a piercing that day. All I got was insulted; when the only thing that came out my mouth was "I don't have the money right now." once told the pierces. I was not given a chance to speak or to defend myself. I just walked out.
I don't know if the artist was in a bad mood or what. But my business is not going there.

resp.text: I believe this to be false. I dont remember you. We dont treat our clients that way, our policy is to respect everyone. We would love to make things right.

text: Absolutely wonderful experience! Pricing for our two piercings was very reasonable and the guy who did them was extremely nice. Gentleman that pierced us was very informative and made me feel like he was an old friend. The piercings themselves look awesome and are placed in perfect spots! I’ve never had a better experience in a tattoo/piercing shop... super friendly, nice guy full of knowledge about care and his practice. Very clean and sterile too! Gave us tons of info about aftercare and made sure we understood everything during the process. Definitely recommend this place for anyone else looking for an enjoyable experience while getting art or piercings.

He seriously loves what he does and takes real pride in his work! The shop is impeccably clean and the atmosphere is awesome! I love Great Southern and will NEVER go anywhere else! text: Went to get my daughters ears pierced the Friday before last. The woman who claimed to be the manager was rude and acted like she had something better to do than to talk to my wife and I, and what ultimately deterred me from the transaction was the fact she was wearing a tank top. I wouldn’t want her arm pits in my face, so I spared my child that experience. We went to Claire’s and had a great experience with a well dress, kind mannered woman who made my child feel at ease.

name: janell johnson
text: Do not go to this place if you are piercing your yound child's ears. I just left from trying to get my 3 year old daughters ears pierced. She was excited and we let her pick her own earrings out. A nice lady helped us but you could tell she was new and learning. She kept having to ask questions to her supervisors who acted like they were too busy to help her, which ultimately took way longer than what it should have taken to complete the transaction, about 45 mins before we were finally asked to come sit in the chair. By that time my daughter was becoming impatient  and started to get nervous. We went to sit in the chair and she started to freak out. The employees just starred at her. They werent nicely trying to tell her that it would be quick or that it would be okay. They just starred. Previously my husband asked if we could pay after the piercing had been done because we werent sure if our daughter would go through with it. We were told no we had to pay immediately. After a minute of trying to get my daughter to cooperate I asked if we could get a refund. We were told no, they do not do refunds. I asked if we could come back another day after she had time to calm down, again we were told no. HORRIBLE, INCONSIDERATE CUSTOMER SERVICE. We took the earrings we paid for and left.

resp.text: Janell, we are so sorry to hear about this experience and will follow up with our team to address what you've stated here. Thank you for being so open about your visit.

name: Angie Lembo
text: Best tattoo shop, nationwide!  Chris is a master artist.  I encourage you to follow their Instagram.  I was looking for a specific font.  I wasn’t sure of placement.  Amy brilliantly suggested the inside of my forearm.  Not painful, at all.  This wasn’t my first tattoo.  I won’t even review the W. Hollywood nor the Maui shops; disasters.  Although, I opted for simplicity, you should see the complex and colourful work.  Incredible!  And, as a Sepsis survivor, every doctor appointment is an opportunity for staff to see a visual “medical alert.”  This tattoo literally saved my life.  In December 2015, I was in the ER. (Ultimately requiring a second colon resection.)  The nurse took my vitals.  Saw the tattoo.  I explained I’d survived Septic Shock, with organ failure.  Enter, Dr. Henry Wang, who oversaw my care.  You can find a plethora of journals and abstracts, he’s written; on Sepsis.  Moral?  Best tattoos at OSI.  And, it just may save your life.

name: Megan Lee
text:
Let me start with the place was clean and had a nice vibe. I contacted them through Facebook looking to set an appointment for two scoop tongue piercings. I sent them a picture of what I wanted and I was told they could do it. I had to pay a 20 dollar deposit to book my appointment and pay the remainder when I got to the shop. First, I had to pay the remainder before even receiving my service which I can understand but that wasn't on their website, Facebook page or anything. Secondly, when I went back to get my piercing, the lady pulled out the wrong kind of bar. I stated,"that's too small. That's not what I want." I pulled my phone out to show her the pic I sent and she told me" yea we don't have that bar for that piercing." She was very like nonchalant. We kept trying to make small talk and ask
Questions and she just seemed annoyed like she didn't wanna deal with us.  So I became upset, because whoever I was talking to on the Facebook page said y'all could do that piercing. Never said y'all didn't have the materials to do so. So she proceeds to show my thicker bars but still not what I initially went there to get. I'm telling her like noo, this not what I wanted.  She asks if I want anything else because they don't do refunds. So I came and paid 70 dollars under the assumption I would get what I wanted, they didn't have it and I couldn't get a refund. MINUS ONE STAR.  So I tell her I'll wait while my sister gets hers done first because I was upset. She got ready to do my sisters. The dots she placed on my sisters tongue were symmetrical  and even, BUT once she pierced her tongue we both instantly noticed it was more so to the left, way left, then the center of her tongue. My sister said she was fine with it. Cool. So I got back in the chair to get mines. I wasn't about to waste 70 bucks. ALSO I FEEL A CUSTOMER SHOULD NOT PAY FOR A SERVICE BEFORE THEY GET IT DONE ! Seeing as how there are no refunds, which I was told after the fact, and then lied about being able to do what I wanted. Anyways, I get in the chair. She is drawing the dots on my tongue and had to mark my tongue like 3-4 times because then we're not even. When she finally gets it even and placed in the middle. Let me say the ink taste terrible! She proceeds to pierce and I can feel as soon as the needle went in and was not near the middle of my tongue. IMMEDIATELY I notice my Piercing is to the left of my tongue also. So I'm irritated all over again. I kept trying to show her how it wasn't in the middle and she says"it's just the way you holding your tongue." Lmao, this was horrible! So I continue to tell her it's not in the middle and she tells me we can take it out and redo it and I'm like fine. She then Says "well not right now I have other appointments coming."
Like NO you should finish with the appointment you already are in and I PAID ! So I leave and then I decided hell no. I'm getting this redone. I go back and she tells me to come back at 4. Two hours later. Cool.
I come back. Have to wait like 30 min. She finally calls be back to redo it. I'm showing her how it's NOT in the middle. The second time hurt like HELL because my tongue was already starting to swell from the first go round. She gets it in a much better position this time. It's closer to middle but VERY slanted. I said thanks and it looks MUCH better then before because it honestly does and I left. My sister wanted hers done over but she saw how painful mines was and neither of us should not have even had to go thru that. It should've been right the first time AND we should've got what we originally came for. So now my tongue is 2x swollen and sore because it had to go thru the trauma  twice ! Her hands were also shakey and normally when people pierce something like a tongue, they stand in front of you. Instead she was on the side which might have been the reason for them being sideways. Like I stated. The place was very clean and had a cool vibe. I just had a bad experience.

name: Amanda Whitlock
text: Tonight, I waited four hours for a four-line tattoo that I never received. If I could give zero stars, I would. I decided to come to Royal Spade after seeing a Facebook post about Friday the 13th tattoo specials. The Facebook post stated that they would be doing small 2-4 inch simple tattoo designs from 1-10pm and it specifically said Walk-In only. I arrived at the shop around 6:30pm and paid for my tattoo. At that point, there were five other people in the waiting area. As I waited, several other people came into the shop. I waited for a couple of hours as the people that came in before me got their tattoos done. At around 9:45, the receptionist called back people that arrived after I did. I was a little confused, so I went to the desk and asked the receptionist if I was next in line. She told me that there was one couple ahead of me but that I would be next after that. She asked what my tattoo was, and I told her it was the symbol for the air element, which was only a triangle with a line through it. She told me that she would try to squeeze me in next before the couple because my tattoo was so simple. At around 10:30, the couple that was ahead of me was called back. A few minutes later, another couple that arrived after me was called back. I went to the front desk and told the receptionist that I thought I was next. It was at this point that one of the tattoo artists came up and told me that they could not keep tattooing all night and that they could not accept walk-ins all night. I pointed out that people who arrived after me were called back, and that I had been there since 6:30pm. That is when he informed me that everyone that was called back had been in earlier that day and were told to come back later. I was dumbfounded that I was not told this once; not when I came in nor during the four-hour duration I spent waiting. I was not informed about any possibility that I would not be able to get my tattoo tonight until after I had been waiting four hours, and then was told that I could not get my tattoo. It also makes no sense to me why people could leave and come back for a special that was advertised as Walk-In only. I am extremely disappointed in the lack of organization and customer service of this shop and I would not wish this horrible experience on anyone.

resp.text: We already told you that we were sorry we cannot get to your tattoo, we were booked for the rest of the day. if you paid for your tattoo? you can come back for a refund tomorrow, but that's about it. we will not be able to help you with any other services in the future due to your lack of respect for us.

name: Jay Johnson
text: the man that did my tattoos was very nice but the tattoos turned out HORRIBLY.. they just turned into open scabs and one of them formed a water bubble as if it were a burn. I went back to show them the tattoo and the first thing that was asked was “did you get it here” .... KNOWING that they had JUST seen me.!! Then I was directed to another artist there who DID NOT do my tattoos and wasn’t even there the day i had got them and he clearly knew that something wasn’t right because he asked “what have you put on it.?!?” And I replied “aquaphor” because that’s what they recommended and that’s also what I used for my other previous tattoos. And then he tried to get smart saying how long he’s been in “the chair” and they couldn’t do anything until it “healed” But the thing is when this heals they wouldn’t be able to put ink on the spots that are MISSING SKIN and they KNOW IT. I was extremely polite until they tried to pass it off like they didn’t see my skin and the colored FLESH that was showing because the artist dug wayyy too deep. I was even okay with the artist not making the tattoo the color i wanted because he claimed he “couldn’t see well” that night so i went with a whole nother tattoo look than i was going for.& I thought it still turned out nicely until things took a turn for the worst.  I know how tattoos are supposed to heal because I have them and have went to MULTIPLE ARTISTS so It’s not me being “picky” or rude . I at least wanted them to be more concerned but I couldn’t get an apology, an offer to make things right, or even my money back. But I have contacted my lawyer and I will have to make the necessary steps.!! Like I said the man who did the tatt was  NICE as ever but he dug too deep and it left permanent damage on both tats and it could’ve went differently had they at least acknowledged what was wrong. Truly sad the way things were handled/not handled.!! No one wants to have messed up skin especially in a place where it’s visible to people. I trusted them with my skin and the art but got done horribly.. this is why I believe with some places you need to just pay half or pay after the work is done and even if you pay before hand, if something goes wrong because of THEM and you go to them in a polite manner even though this is your body so you have a reason to be alarm and HEATED ....then they should at least do everything in their power to make it right and pay you back and try to fix it. But like I said there’s no fixing this and they knew it that’s why I had to take legal action. Not trying to bash their business or anything because my first initial thought was “they’re pretty nice people and it’s a cool space” when i first walked in to set the appointment but as far as my experience and things .... I definitely won’t be going there again and the way they handled my situation.. I highly wouldn’t recommend and that’s just me.!!
